general.name: General
general.description: Everyday household waste that cannot be recycled, including items like used tissues, straw, and plastic bag.

food.name: Organic
food.description: Organic waste is biodegradable waste from kitchen scraps and yard trimmings, such as fruit peels, vegetable scraps, and grass clippings.

paper.name: Paper
paper.description: Paper-based materials that can be recycled, such as newspapers, magazines, cardboard boxes, and office paper.

plastic.name: Plastic
plastic.description: There are various types of plastic containers, bottles, and packaging that can be recycled, containing a symbol of PET (polyethylene terephthalate), HDPE (high-density polyethylene), and PVC (polyvinyl chloride).

aluminium.name: Aluminium
aluminium.description: Aluminum objects like cans, foil, and other aluminum packaging.

glass.name: Glass
glass.description: Glass containers and bottles that can be recycled, including clear, green, and brown glass.

biohazard.name: Hazardous
biohazard.description: Materials that might be dangerous to human health or the environment, such as batteries, pesticides, and certain household chemicals.

electronic.name: Electronic
electronic.description: Discarded electronic devices like computers, cell phones, and televisions, which contain hazardous materials and should be recycled responsibly.

knowledge_dialog.warning: - sorting methods might be different between countries -
knowledge_dialog.recommend: - always try to fix and reuse before thow anything away -
